Node.definition: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

literally: to set (one's) face (in a certain direction); hence: = action by which humans or deities fix their eyes in a certain direction, often with the purpose of going there or taking action against it
literally: road; hence: = a point to or from which a person or thing moves or faces, ◄ understood as the road between that person or thing and the point in focus
= area located to the south of a point of reference
= a cardinal direction to the right of a person facing the sunrise
= a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals

= a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

= an area of land located in the south of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) consisting of little vegetation and with very little annual rainfall; inhabited by numerous peoples initially by the Canaanites in Arad (עֲרָד) and the Amelekites (עֲמָלֵקִי) later, the people of Judah (יְהוּדָה)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals

= an area of land located in the south of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) consisting of little vegetation and with very little annual rainfall; inhabited by numerous peoples initially by the Canaanites in Arad (עֲרָד) and the Amelekites (עֲמָלֵקִי) later, the people of Judah (יְהוּדָה)
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to set fire on|to set on fire
Node.definition: = action by which someone causes something to start burning, usually with effects on people and nature around; ≈ associated with punishment and judgement

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten
= any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit
= state in which a fruit, tree branch, or other natural product still contains some of its internal juices and has not yet dried out
= any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit
= state in which objects are free from moisture
= process by which a fire comes to an end, either in a natural way or by force
= hot glowing body of fire (אֵשׁ) ≈ poetic
= process of being damaged by fire
= a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the right of a person facing the direction of the rising sun, ◄ which is the direction of the Negev desert
= a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the left of a person when facing the direction of the rising sun‎, ◄ named after Mount Zaphon which is located in northern Syria

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= living creature, including both humans and animals; ◄ conceived as an object that mainly consists of flesh; ≈ regarded as weak and passing
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which someone causes something else to be harmed or destroyed by fire
= process by which a fire comes to an end, either in a natural way or by force

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
exclamation expressing grief and dismay
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord

marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

literally: to set (one's) face (in a certain direction); hence: = action by which humans or deities fix their eyes in a certain direction, often with the purpose of going there or taking action against it
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= place that has been consecrated to a deity, where that deity is said to reside and is worshiped

= the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to bring out|to take out|to carry out|to make (someone) leave|to make (someone) depart
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans, animals, or objects to leave a certain place or position
= offensive weapon consisting of long blade for cutting or thrusting or both, and hilt with hand guard; ◄ made out of iron; ► used in warfare; ≈ symbol of aggression and punishment

= case or bag about the size and shape of a sword, attached to a circular strap or belt that could be hung over the shoulder or tied around the waist, or to a combination of a belt and a shoulder strap; ► used to cover and to carry the sword
literally: to cut off (people); hence: = causative action by which humans and deities cause (other) humans to die a violent death
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes
literally: to cut off (people); hence: = causative action by which humans and deities cause (other) humans to die a violent death
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
= offensive weapon consisting of long blade for cutting or thrusting or both, and hilt with hand guard; ◄ made out of iron; ► used in warfare; ≈ symbol of aggression and punishment

= case or bag about the size and shape of a sword, attached to a circular strap or belt that could be hung over the shoulder or tied around the waist, or to a combination of a belt and a shoulder strap; ► used to cover and to carry the sword
= living creature, including both humans and animals; ◄ conceived as an object that mainly consists of flesh; ≈ regarded as weak and passing
= a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the right of a person facing the direction of the rising sun, ◄ which is the direction of the Negev desert
= a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the left of a person when facing the direction of the rising sun‎, ◄ named after Mount Zaphon which is located in northern Syria
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= living creature, including both humans and animals; ◄ conceived as an object that mainly consists of flesh; ≈ regarded as weak and passing
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans, animals, or objects to leave a certain place or position
= offensive weapon consisting of long blade for cutting or thrusting or both, and hilt with hand guard; ◄ made out of iron; ► used in warfare; ≈ symbol of aggression and punishment

= case or bag about the size and shape of a sword, attached to a circular strap or belt that could be hung over the shoulder or tied around the waist, or to a combination of a belt and a shoulder strap; ► used to cover and to carry the sword
literally: to turn; hence: = process by which objects move back into the direction they came from
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= action by which humans or animals make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering

= the two sides of the body of humans and certain animals between the rib cage and the hips, ► which is the place where people normally tie a girdle, breeches, loincloth, or sackcloth; ≈ a symbol of strength
= action by which humans or animals make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= action by which humans or animals make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call

= process by which substances become soft, ◄ often as a result of a higher temperature
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
literally: (one's) hands are weak; hence: = state in which humans lack the confidence to perform a certain event
literally: (one's) spirit weakens; hence: = process by which humans lose their courage and grow afraid
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
= central area of the leg where the thigh is joined to the lower leg; ≈ associated with stability and strength
literally: (one's) knees turn to water; hence: = to lose (one's) courage

= offensive weapon consisting of long blade for cutting or thrusting or both, and hilt with hand guard; ◄ made out of iron; ► used in warfare; ≈ symbol of aggression and punishment

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= causative action by which humans or deities kill other humans with a sharp bladed instrument; ≈ associated with anger, power, callousness (of the killer), and helplessness (of the victim)
= causative action by which humans kill other humans like an animal, with a sharp bladed instrument; ≈ associated with anger, power, callousness (of the killer), and helplessness (of the victim)
= causative action by which humans use an iron tool to cause an object to have a thin cutting edge, ► in order to make it useful and effective as a tool; ≈ often associated with aggression and danger
= process by which an object reflects light, often because it has been polished
exact meaning unknown, possible: = particle marking an oath or a similar strongly worded statement
literally: stick, rod; hence: = process of causing systematic suffering to someone else ◄ as if one were beating someone else with a rod
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events
= a single piece of wood taken from a tree, cut and finished, and used for building and construction

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= the inner part of the human hand (יָד) but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way
= action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else
= action by which humans utter a high pitched cry to give expression to an emotion, which is usually grief or distress, but can also be triumph and glee
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

= offensive weapon consisting of long blade for cutting or thrusting or both, and hilt with hand guard; ◄ made out of iron; ► used in warfare; ≈ symbol of aggression and punishment
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
literally: to strike (one's) thigh; = action by which humans express their shame and grief by striking their thigh
literally: to strike (one's) thigh; hence: = action by which humans strike their upper leg to give expression to their grief

= action by which humans or deities examine the character of other humans or deities by having them engage in a certain activity, ◄ as a goldsmith tests the quality of a precious metal by smelting it in the fire|= action by which humans or deities evaluate the dependability and/or reliability of someone else ◄ as an assayer examines ore or metal

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group

= causative action by which deities call objects to existence

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives
= offensive weapon consisting of long blade for cutting or thrusting or both, and hilt with hand guard; ◄ made out of iron; ► used in warfare; ≈ symbol of aggression and punishment
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= state in which a countable entity is one in number

Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
= state in which a countable entity is two in number

literally: hand; hence: = a pillar like object made out of rock, possibly with a hand engraved upon it (as has been found on other ancient monuments, as a symbol of power or of prayer) ► set up in honor or memorial of someone (known ancient ones are in honor of a king or god)

Node.gloss: to cut|to clear (by cutting)|to carve|to hack (at someone)
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans cause something else to get its desired shape by cutting off certain parts of it
literally: head; hence: = the topmost part of a vertically oriented object, such as a mountain, and the principal part of an horizontally oriented object, such as a street or a bed

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

Node.gloss: to cut|to clear (by cutting)|to carve|to hack (at someone)
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans cause something else to get its desired shape by cutting off certain parts of it

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives
= causative action by which deities call objects to existence
= offensive weapon consisting of long blade for cutting or thrusting or both, and hilt with hand guard; ◄ made out of iron; ► used in warfare; ≈ symbol of aggression and punishment

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

see רַבָּה (רַבָּה)|= town, also known as Rabbah of the Ammonites (רַב) ◄ and located in Ammon; ► capital of the Ammonite kingdom, first conquered by Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) on their way from Egypt (מִצְרַיִם) and later again by David (דָּוִד)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= nation; ◄ situated E. of river Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) according to founded by Ben Ammi (בֶּן־עַמִּי) son of Lot (לֹוט)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= state in which an area has been made inaccessible and strong, beyond the reach of others, such as enemies, ◄ usually by surrounding it by a high wall
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire

Node.gloss: the mother of the way = the parting of a way
Node.definition: = the place where a road splits into two or more other roads; ◄ here compared to a mother with multiple children

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives
literally: head; hence: = the topmost part of a vertically oriented object, such as a mountain, and the principal part of an horizontally oriented object, such as a street or a bed
= state in which a countable entity is two in number

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

= action by which humans communicate with the spirit world using a variety of means such as inspecting the liver of animals, shaking arrows, consulting teraphim, or casting lots; ≈ usually regarded as an evil practice that is to be condemned; responsibility of a prophet or king

= action by which humans communicate with the spirit world using a variety of means such as inspecting the liver of animals, shaking arrows, consulting teraphim, or casting lots; ≈ usually regarded as an evil practice that is to be condemned; responsibility of a prophet or king
= causative action by which human shakes objects inside a container

= pointed missile, shot from a bow; slender and straight in shape and moving swiftly; ◄ made out of wood and/or iron; ► mainly used for hunting, in warfare, and occasionally for divination; ≈ symbol of aggression, affliction, and punishment
= a small and portable physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing, ► functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship or divination

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= a large lobed glandular organ in the abdomen, involved in processing digestive products, neutralizing toxins, and other metabolic processes
= the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun
= object used in divination, representing one of the possible options
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom

Node.gloss: to place|to put|to lay|to set|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects or (other) humans to be located in a certain place
literally: young ram; hence: = a log or other long, heavy piece of wood, covered on one end with metal; ► used by soldiers to strike the wall or gate of a city under siege repeatedly
= action by which humans or animals open their mouth ► in order to speak
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= causative action by which humans take the life of other humans, whether or not intentionally
literally: to lift up (one's) voice; hence: = action by which humans speak more loudly than usual
= loud sound ◄ produced either by the human voice or by musical instruments ► used to express an emotion or to communicate something to a community

Node.gloss: to place|to put|to lay|to set|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects or (other) humans to be located in a certain place
literally: young ram; hence: = a log or other long, heavy piece of wood, covered on one end with metal; ► used by soldiers to strike the wall or gate of a city under siege repeatedly
literally: to pour out a mound; hence: = causative action by which humans cast up a large mound of earth to protect themselves while surrounding an enemy
= earthen mound, cast up against the wall of a city ► in order to enable to enemy to scale the wall
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one
= fence of poles or stakes, sometimes reinforced with, or even made of earth and stones; ► used to fortify entrenchments

= action by which humans communicate with the spirit world using a variety of means such as inspecting the liver of animals, shaking arrows, consulting teraphim, or casting lots; ≈ usually regarded as an evil practice that is to be condemned; responsibility of a prophet or king
literally: falsehood; hence: = state in which things that are being communicated are factually untrue

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
see שְׁבוּעָה (שְׁבוּעָה)
see שְׁבוּעָה (שְׁבוּעָה)
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= causative action by which humans or deities cause information that is stored in someone else's mind to be reprocessed by speaking about it
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= process by which certain information becomes publicly available
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

Node.gloss: to be seen|to become visible|to appear
Node.definition: = process by which humans, deities, or objects become perceptible, primarily though not necessarily exclusively to the eye
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= a pattern of activities performed by a person or deity, with the primary focus on whether these activities are good or evil
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes

literally: palm of the hand, with the focus on one of the activities that are performed with the hands: to hold someone against that person's will; = condition of being under the malevolent control of another person or group
= state in which humans are in a state of dishonor or disgrace; ◄ because of one's own or somebody else's actions
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= state of having reached the terminal point of an event

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= a headpiece formed by winding a long piece of cloth many times around the top of the head; it may have been wound permanently and put on and taken off like a hat; ► worn by priests, but also by kings
literally: to lift up; hence: = action by which humans pick up (part of) an object with their hands

= circular or semi circular ornamental headdress, ◄ usually made out of precious metals and decorated with jewels, ► worn by kings, priests, and officials as a symbol of authority and status; also given to women by their suitors to win their affection
= causative action by which humans are given an elevated status in the eyes of other people, ≈ which is regarded as a good thing
= state in which a person has a relatively high status within the context of a society or a position of leadership
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= state in which humans are morally or legally entitled to participate in a certain event
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= nation; ◄ situated E. of river Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) according to founded by Ben Ammi (בֶּן־עַמִּי) son of Lot (לֹוט)
= causative action by which humans make an effort to arouse an emotion of shame in (other) humans or deities; ◄ by their words or actions

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= offensive weapon consisting of long blade for cutting or thrusting or both, and hilt with hand guard; ◄ made out of iron; ► used in warfare; ≈ symbol of aggression and punishment
= offensive weapon consisting of long blade for cutting or thrusting or both, and hilt with hand guard; ◄ made out of iron; ► used in warfare; ≈ symbol of aggression and punishment

= causative action by which humans or deities allow others entrance, passage, or access (in)to a building, construction, or area ◄ by withdrawing a gate, door, window, lid, covering, or other boundary; ≈ sometimes associated with freedom, sometimes with being exposed, vulnerable
= causative action by which humans kill other humans like an animal, with a sharp bladed instrument; ≈ associated with anger, power, callousness (of the killer), and helplessness (of the victim)
= process by which humans or objects attain a certain goal
= process by which an object reflects light, often because it has been polished

Node.gloss: to receive as a vision|to have a vision
Node.definition: = process by which humans perceive something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition
literally: falsehood; hence: = state in which things that are being communicated are factually untrue

= action by which humans communicate with the spirit world using a variety of means such as inspecting the liver of animals, shaking arrows, consulting teraphim, or casting lots; ≈ usually regarded as an evil practice that is to be condemned; responsibility of a prophet or king
literally: falsehood; hence: = things that cannot be trusted

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= part of the body connecting the rump to the head; ► a ;place to wear ornaments, but also a yoke; ≈ a stiff neck is associated with insolence and pride
= state in which humans are in a state of dishonor or disgrace; ◄ because of one's own or somebody else's actions
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= state of having reached the terminal point of an event

Node.gloss: to take back|to bring back|to return|to put back|to restore (something)
Node.definition: literally: to turn; hence: = causative action by which animals, humans, deities cause (other) animals, humans, or objects to move back to a location where they have been before

= case or bag about the size and shape of a sword, attached to a circular strap or belt that could be hung over the shoulder or tied around the waist, or to a combination of a belt and a shoulder strap; ► used to cover and to carry the sword
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which a deity brings to existence something that did not exist before

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= the place where one is originally from

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: to pout our (one's) anger; hence: = action by which deities give full vent to their anger by punishing the offender
= action by which humans or deities express their intense anger; ◄ caused by someone else's behavior, ► almost invariably resulting in punishment for the party that is responsible

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people

Node.gloss: to be dull|to be stupid|to be coarse|to be brutish
Node.definition: = state in which someone lacks intelligence, refinement and culture
= person who has the ability and skill to carry out a certain event

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= things that are burnt up by fire ◄ as if it were eaten by it

= red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of life (נֶפֶשׁ) human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
